bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, October 5, 1928

div1.p: Carter tells Russell that she has met with Frost to clarify the remaining references that need to be verified.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Frederick F. Russell, October 5, 1928

opener.dateline:
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
October 5, 1928

div1.p:
I have the honor to report another week of excellent re-
sults, considering how very difficult it is to trace the references
remaining to be verified. Miss Brown and I worked together until late
Saturday night, and started in again right after breakfast Sunday morn-
ing, she having spent the week-end with me.

In addition to our work in Washington, I put in a long, and
most satisfactory, day in Baltimore with Dr. Frost last Wednesday. Dr.
Frost has made wonderful progress on the final editing in the short
time since he began it.

I brought back a typed Memorandum of what Dr. Frost most
desired in the near future and, on my return to Washington yesterday,
went straight from an early train to the Library, where Miss Brown and I
at once began intensive work, in accordance with Frost's Memorandum.

With best wishes, and hoping that we shall see you in
Washington in the not too distant future.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (Signed) Laura A. Carter. Dr. Frederick F. Russell.
Director,
International Health Division
The Rockefeller Foundation,
61 Broadway,
New York, N. Y.
